eligibility: Active-duty military member stationed in CA on military orders, or dependent of such member
duration: Continuous while parent is stationed in CA + 1 year after separation/retirement if student remains in CA
notes: Student need not be CA resident; applies even if stationed abroad but CA is home of record

eligibility: Active-duty military member stationed in VA, or dependent of such member, or member using GI Bill benefits
duration: Continuous while using GI Bill benefits or while parent is active duty
notes: Also applies to veterans using GI Bill within 3 years of discharge

eligibility: Active-duty military member stationed in NC or SC (reciprocal agreement), or dependent of such member
duration: Continuous while parent is stationed in NC/SC + 1 year after separation if student remains in NC
notes: Reciprocal agreement with SC for military stationed at Fort Jackson, Shaw AFB, etc.

eligibility: Active-duty military member stationed in MI, or dependent of such member, or veteran using GI Bill
documentation: Certificate of Eligibility (COE) for GI Bill
duration: Continuous while using GI Bill or while parent is active duty
notes: Also applies to veterans within 3 years of discharge using GI Bill

eligibility: Active-duty military member stationed in WI, or dependent of such member, or veteran using GI Bill
duration: Continuous while parent is active duty or while using GI Bill
notes: Applies to all branches of military including National Guard on active orders

policy_name: Post-9/11 GI Bill In-State Tuition (Choice Act)
eligibility: Veterans or dependents using Post-9/11 GI Bill or Chapter 31 benefits
tuition_benefit: In-state tuition rates at all public colleges nationwide
duration: Continuous while using GI Bill benefits
applies_to: All public colleges in all 50 states
statute: Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 (Choice Act)
notes: Federal law requires all public colleges to charge in-state tuition to GI Bill users

eligibility: Veterans using Post-9/11 GI Bill at 100% eligibility level
tuition_benefit: Additional funding beyond GI Bill cap (school matches VA contribution)
duration: Varies by school (some unlimited, some capped at specific number of students)
applies_to: Participating schools only (check VA Yellow Ribbon database)
notes: School agrees to waive tuition above GI Bill cap, VA matches up to 50% of difference. Check school-specific Yellow Ribbon amounts.

eligibility: Students who attended Department of Defense Education Activity (DODEA) schools
notes: DODEA schools are fully accredited. Transcripts include APO/FPO addresses (military postal system). Colleges should evaluate DODEA credits same as U.S. public school credits. DODEA offers AP, IB, and dual enrollment programs.

policy_name: Military Dependent Transfer of GI Bill Benefits
eligibility: Dependents (spouse or children) of active-duty service member who transfers Post-9/11 GI Bill benefits
documentation: Certificate of Eligibility (COE) showing transferred benefits
tuition_benefit: Up to 36 months of GI Bill benefits (tuition + housing allowance + books)
duration: 36 months total (can be used over multiple years)
notes: Service member must have 6+ years of service and agree to serve 4 more years to transfer benefits. Children can use benefits until age 26. Spouse has no age limit but must use while member is in service or within 15 years of separation.

eligibility: U.S. citizens or permanent residents living abroad (including military stationed abroad)
notes: If parents file Form 2555 to exclude foreign earned income from U.S. taxes, they must ADD BACK the excluded income on FAFSA. This increases EFC. Housing allowances (BAH/OHA) for military are NOT taxable but must be reported on FAFSA as untaxed income.
